headline: Should You Rethink Coca-Cola After Its 15% Stock Rally in 2025?
summary: If you’re staring at Coca-Cola’s stock and wondering whether to hold, buy in, or move on, you’re not alone. Coke has been turning heads lately, especially with its share price consistently rising. The stock is up 5.6% over just the past week and nearly 15% so far this year. For a company with more than 130 years of history, those numbers get investors talking. Many are asking what’s fueling this momentum, and whether the stock is a bargain or a risk at these levels. Some of the recent...

headline: Why Beyond Meat (BYND) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of plant-based protein company Beyond Meat (NASDAQ:BYND) fell 14.5% in the afternoon session after the recent, unsustainable 'meme stock' rally appeared to collapse, with the stock reversing sharply after a massive surge in the previous week.

headline: WPP cuts out the agency to help brands create their own ads with AI
summary: LONDON (Reuters) -British ad group WPP said on Thursday it was letting brands access its AI-powered marketing platform to plan, create and publish their own campaigns.  WPP Open Pro, a new edition of its AI platform WPP Open, has been designed for smaller brands that do not use full-service agencies, it said, as well as to provide new capabilities to existing clients.  Advertising groups are facing the challenge of brands starting to use AI to do more of their own creative and planning work, reducing the fees they pay to agencies.

headline: Blackstone (NYSE:BX) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q3 Earnings
summary: Alternative investment manager Blackstone (NYSE:BX) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales rose 26.6% year on year to $3.09 billion. Its GAAP profit of $0.80 per share was 34.8% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: How Recent Analyst Shifts Are Changing the Story for Coca-Cola's Valuation
summary: Coca-Cola's stock price target has been slightly revised downward, with analysts now estimating fair value per share at $77.57, compared with the previous target of $77.79. This modest adjustment reflects a balance of optimism around the company's continued performance and caution arising from softness in some international markets. Stay tuned to discover how investors can remain informed as perspectives on Coca-Cola's outlook continue to shift. What Wall Street Has Been Saying Analyst...
